Generally speaking, successfully chop down any Small Tree, Small Root or Giant Tree will grant you a reward of some sorts.
The rewards range from Wood, Fruit to Insect – each contribute different values to certain features of the game.
The Wood is mainly used in building and upgrading in-game facilities, which benefit all other aspects of the game.
The Fruit is mainly used in Cooking and Concoction – some can even be used to feed the Undeads.
The Insect is mainly used in Concoction and can also be made into unique fish baits – which strongly enhance the Fishing experience.
Other rare items such as Undead eggs and Hidden Treasure chests can also be found in the Foraging game.
Click on any tree to start chopping it. For every chop you will need a small amount of Stamina to trigger a minigame.
A black bar with green and red zone will appear on the screen. A white chopping mark will move linearly from side to side at a constant speed. Click/ tap anywhere on the screen to chop.
If the chopping mark lands on the green zone, you will deal 1 damage to the tree – and if it hits the red zone, you will deal 2 damage instead.
But beware: if the chopping marks “accidentally” lands on the black zone, it will cost you double Stamina and deal no damage to the tree at all!
Successfully reducing the HP of the Small Trees to 0 will net you some minor reward – but then the Small Root will be revealed, which is actuall the real prize.
Giant Trees require the Foraging Skill to be at least at Lv.4. Giant Trees possess tremendous HP compared the Small Trees, but they don’t leave roots when cut down at all.
Successfully chop down trees of any size will grant you EXP to increase your Foraging Skill level – the higher it is, the more effective you can play the Foraging game in the long term.

A Foraging trip only ends when you find the Key. Key is a loot from chopping the Small Roots or Giant Trees with very low chance to appear. Don’t worry though, since the last tree in the woods is guaranteed to drop the Key (if you haven’t found one before).
Click on the water surface to cast the fishing rod (each cast costs a certain amount of Stamina – which can be reduced via the Skill Tree System and/ or the Equipment System).

Pay attention to the ripples on the water surface and the tension of the line. When a fish really takes the bait, the line will be straightened up and BAM, this is the perfect time to click again to start a “Fish fight”.

During a “Fish fight”, a long bar will appear on the screen with a “catch bar” and a “fish icon” inside. Hold your mouse/ screen (if played on a smartphone) to move the catch bar toward the RIGHT side, or release to move it toward the LEFT side.
The goal is to contain the fish icon within the catch bar as long as possible, as it will slowly fill the result gauge. When the gauge is fully filled, you successfully catch the fish!

Note #1: Fishes of different difficulties will be hinted by the color of the catch bar (Green for Common, Yellow for Rare, and Red for Epic). The higher difficulty, the shorter the catch bar will become (which can be leveraged via your Fishing Skill Level)

Note #2: A successful catch doesn’t always come with a decent reward. Sometimes Lady Luck is simply absent and you will only hook up Trash items – but don’t let that discourage you, since higher level of Fishing Skill will significantly reduce the chance to get Trash items.
Generally speaking, successfully catch a “Fish” will net you a generous reward.

The “Fishes” are actually categorized into Fish, Crustacean and Fauna – which can be fed to your Undeads to raise their levels. Different types/ rarities of food provide different amount of EXP – some are particularly more effective if they’re the favourite snacks of certain kinds of Undead.
Aside from serving as Undead food, these catches can be used in different key features such as Crafting, Forging or Cooking (which will be available in later updates).
With a little bit of luck, you might gain really rare items such as Undead eggs and/ or Treasure chests, which yield significant value to your playing experience overall.
By successfully catching a “Fish”, you will gain EXP to increase your Fishing Skill Level. The higher level your are, the more effective and rewarding your Fishing game will become.
So take time, relax and chill while earning back your investment of money, time and effort in various ways.
